info.title: Digital Twins Service Management APIs
info.description:
The Digital Twins Service allows for managing IoT devices within spaces on Microsoft Azure.

This guide describes the REST APIs to manage these devices.

For more documentation, please follow [this link](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/digital-twins/).

##

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of ids to filter by

parameters.name: hardwareIds
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of hardware ids (such as MAC addresses) to filter by

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of names to filter by

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of device types to filter by.

parameters.name: subtypes
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of device subtypes to filter by.

parameters.name: gateways
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of gateway ids to filter by

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optional ';' or ',' delimited list of status to filter by. E.g: status=Disabled,Offline

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: Comma separated list of what to include, for example "Sensors,SasToken". Defaults to None

parameters.name: propertyKey
parameters.description: Optional filter on objects that have the given property key defined

parameters.name: propertyValue
parameters.description: Optional filter on the value of the given property key

parameters.name: propertyValueSearchType
parameters.description: Optional type of search on property value. Contains or Equals. Defaults to Equals

parameters.name: spaceId
parameters.description: Optionally filter on objects based on their location in the topology relative to the specified spaceId

parameters.name: traverse
parameters.description: None (the default) for the specified spaceId only, Down for space and descendants, Up for spaceId and ancestors, Any for both

parameters.name: minLevel
parameters.description: Optional filter on minimum level, inclusive

parameters.name: maxLevel
parameters.description: Optional filter on maximum level, inclusive

parameters.name: minRelative
parameters.description: Specify if min level is absolute or relative

parameters.name: maxRelative
parameters.description: Specify if max level is absolute or relative

Key value pairs specified in the Content-Disposition header in the blob-chunk of the multipart request will be preserved as meta-data on the stored blob.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The AAD tenantId of the user, disallowed for GatewayDevice role assignments

get.summary: Gets role assignments under a given path

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path under which role assignments are searched

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Optional object id filter. This corresponds to an object id used in a role assignment creation.

parameters.name: personal
parameters.description: Optionally make the search return only the role assignments that are applicable to the user sending the request

parameters.name: traverse
parameters.description: Optionally specify if you want to recursively include children (Down) of the specified path. Other traversal directions are not supported.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The role assignment information.

parameters.description: Role assignment id

delete.summary: Deletes a space and its children, such as devices, sensors, users, ...
delete.description:
Deleting a space will fail if one of these objects belongs in the space tree about to be deleted:
            - Space resource: These need to be deleted first.
            - Sensors attached to devices that do **not** belong in the space tree about to be deleted: these (or their parent device) need to be deleted first.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Space Id

This is a multi-part request. For more information, see sample app or doc examples.
Key value pairs specified in the Content-Disposition header in the blob-chunk of the multipart request will be preserved as meta-data on the stored blob.

PropertiesAndTreeFiltersModel.description: Due to a bug in swagger generation, cannot have two [FromUri] classes on the same API, therefore must combine both classes

propertyKey.description: Optional filter on objects that have the given property key defined

propertyValue.description: Optional filter on the value of the given property key

propertyValueSearchType.description: Optional type of search on property value. Contains or Equals. Defaults to Equals

spaceId.description: Optionally filter on objects based on their location in the topology relative to the specified spaceId

traverse.description: None (the default) for the specified spaceId only, Down for space and descendants, Up for spaceId and ancestors, Any for both

minLevel.description: Optional filter on minimum level, inclusive

maxLevel.description: Optional filter on maximum level, inclusive

minRelative.description: Specify if min level is absolute or relative

maxRelative.description: Specify if max level is absolute or relative

hardwareId.description: Hardware unique identifier, such as MAC address.

connectionState.description: The connection state of the device

connectionStateUpdatedTime.description: The time when {ModernIoT.Data.DataModel.DeviceRetrieve.ConnectionState} was last updated.

roleAssignments.description: The role assignments associated with the device.

location.description: Optional physical location for the space

timeZoneId.description: Optional time zone identifier for the space

effectiveTimeZoneId.description: Same as TimeZoneId, if defined. Otherwise same as EffectiveTimeZoneId of parent space

port.description: Serial port the sensor connects to on the device

pollRate.description: Poll rate for data collection from the sensor

dataType.description: Type of data reported by the sensor

portType.description: Type of port; for example AnalogInput. Defaults to None

dataUnitType.description: Type of unit; for example CelsiusTemperature if DataType is set to Temperature. Defaults to None

hardwareId.description: Hardware unique identifier, such as a MAC address.

dataType.description: The declared datatype of the property key

isExternallyCreated.description: If the resource was created externally

parameters.description: Resource-type-dependent template parameters

lastUpdatedUtc.description: Last time the record was updated

dependentChildren.description: List of resources the current resource is dependending on

dependentAncestors.description: List of resources that are depending on the current resource

roleId.description: The role definition identifier. Role definitions and their identifiers can be found by querying the system API.

objectId.description:
The object id for the role assignment that must be formatted according to its associated type.
For the DomainName ObjectIdType, ObjectId must begin with the "@" character.

objectIdType.description:
The type of the role assignment. With the exception of the DeviceId type, the types correspond to properties of an AAD object. The DeviceId type corresponds to
the device id in the topology.
The UserId type assigns a role to a user.
The DeviceId type assigns a role to a device.
The DomainName type assigns a role to a domain name. Each user with the specified domain name will have the access rights of the corresponding role.
The TenantId type assigns a role to a tenant. Each user belonging to the specified tenant id will have the access rights of the corresponding role.
The ServicePrincipalId type assigns a role to a service principal object id.

tenantId.description:
The tenant identifier.
Disallowed for DeviceId and TenantId ObjectIdTypes.
Required for UserId and ServicePrincipalId ObjectIdTypes.
Optional for the DomainName ObjectIdType.

type.description:
Value type, for example motion or temperature. Maps to Sensor.DataType
TODO: should we rename to dataType?

timestamp.description: Last updated date and time in UTC.

SensorHistoryValue.description: Historical entry for a sensor's value.

typeId.description: Device type identifier. Cannot specify both Type and TypeId

subtypeId.description: Device subtype identifier. Cannot specify both Subtype and SubtypeId

hardwareId.description: Hardware unique identifier, such as MAC address.

createIoTHubDevice.description:
Flag to specify that corresponding IoT Hub device should be created at the same
time as the SBS device. IoT Hub device can be created later by requesting the
IoT Hub URL, IoT Hub connection string, or device key for the device.
Defaults to true.

parentDeviceType.description:
If specified, automatically set the devices GatewayId to a device of the given type.
Must include both ParentDeviceType and ParentDeviceSubtype with a null GatewayId

parentDeviceSubtype.description:
If specified, automatically set the devices GatewayId to a device of the given type.
Must include both ParentDeviceType and ParentDeviceSubtype with a null GatewayId

port.description: Serial port the sensor connects to on the device

pollRate.description: Poll rate for data collection from the sensor

dataType.description: Type of data reported by the sensor

portType.description: Type of port; for example AnalogInput. Defaults to None

dataUnitType.description: Type of unit; for example CelsiusTemperature if DataType is set to Temperature. Defaults to None

dataSubtype.description: Subtype for the data; for example OutsideTemperature if DataType is set to Temperature. Defaults to None

spaceId.description: Parent space Id. If not specified, the device's parent space is used

portTypeId.description: Port type identifier. Cannot specify both PortType and PortTypeId

dataUnitTypeId.description: Data type unit identifier. Cannot specify both DataUnitType and DataUnitTypeId

typeId.description: Type identifier. Cannot specify both Type and TypeId

dataTypeId.description: Data type identifier. Cannot specify both DataType and DataTypeId

dataSubtypeId.description: Data subtype identifier. Cannot specify both DataSubtype and DataSubtypeId

hardwareId.description: Hardware unique identifier, such as MAC address. If left unspecified, set to a random Guid string.

name.description: The name of an already defined property key

hardwareId.description: Hardware unique identifier, such as MAC address.

location.description: Optional physical location, or a location of (0,0) to reset to no location

typeId.description: Device type identifier. Cannot specify both Type and TypeId

subtypeId.description: Device subtype identifier. Cannot specify both Subtype and SubtypeId

KeyStoreRetrieve.description: Payload when retrieving a key store

spaceId.description: Id of the parent space container

SecurityKeyRetrieve.description: Payload when retrieving a security key

traverse.description: None (the default) for the specified spaceId only, Down for space and descendants, Up for spaceId and ancestors, Any for both

minLevel.description: Optional filter on minimum level, inclusive

maxLevel.description: Optional filter on maximum level, inclusive

minRelative.description: Specify if min level is absolute or relative

maxRelative.description: Specify if max level is absolute or relative

typeId.description: Type identifier. Cannot specify both Type and TypeId

subtypeId.description: Subtype identifier. Cannot specify both Subtype and SubtypeId

lastUpdatedUtc.description: Last UTC date and time the endpoint was updated

eventTypes.description: Type of events to send to this endpoint

connectionString.description: Endpoint's primary key or primary connection string

secondaryConnectionString.description: Endpoint's secondary key or secondary connection string

path.description: Path to the endpoint, for example TopicName or EventHubName

secondaryConnectionString.description: Endpoint's secondary key or secondary connection string

spaceId.description: Id of the parent space container

Payload for updating a key store.
TODO: should we allow moving to a different SpaceId during updates?

SecurityKeyUpdate.description: Payload for updating a security key

conditions.description: List of conditions that all need to evaluate to true for a given sensor to match

target.description: What object the condition applies to: the sensor, its parent device or its parent space

path.description: Case sensitive JSON path which is evaluated against the target

conditions.description: List of conditions that all need to evaluate to true for a given sensor to match

userDefinedFunctions.description: List of UDFs that are associated with this matcher

target.description: What object the condition applies to: the sensor, its parent device or its parent space

path.description: Case sensitive JSON path which is evaluated against the target

disabled.description: If disabled, the UDF will not be considered for execution

matchers.description: List of matchers that can trigger execution

conditions.description: List of conditions that all need to evaluate to true for a given sensor to match

id.description:
If specified, Id of the condition to update or delete.
If not specified, condition is created

target.description: What object the condition applies to: the sensor, its parent device or its parent space

path.description:
If specified and not empty, case sensitive JSON path which is evaluated against the target.
If specified and empty, the corresponding Condition is deleted

loaded.description: If true, new extended types associated with this ontology are automatically enabled

spaceId.description:
Parent space Id.
If specified, the type is available to this space topology (custom type).
If not, the type is available to all spaces (system type).

category.description: The type's category, for example SensorPortType

disabled.description:
If disabled, a type cannot be be referenced.
This can be used to remove types from loaded ontologies or to prevent "wrong" type names from being created.
For example, creating a disabled type called 'Temp' will enforce using Temperature instead

ontologies.description: List of ontologies this type belongs to

loaded.description:
Switching an ontology from loaded false to true switches all its associated extended types to not Disabled unless they are also associated with another not loaded ontology.
Switching an ontology from loaded true to false switches all its associated extended types to Disabled unless they are also associated with another loaded ontology.

name.description: Key name. Must be unique for a given space. Can only contain alphanumeric or underscore characters

primitiveDataType.description: Primitive data type used for validation. Defaults to None if not specified

category.description: Category. Used for permissioning and filtering. Automatically set to 'None' if not specified

scope.description: The scope the property key applies to

validationData.description:
Optional field used to validate property values.
- For string: an optional regular expression
- For enum or set: a ';' delimited list of possible alphanumeric values
- For JSON: an optional JSON schema

min.description:
Optional field used to limit the range of property values.
- For value types (int, long, datetime) the boundary value.
- For string and JSON the number of characters.
- For Set the number of elements.

max.description:
Optional field used to limit the range of property values.
- For value types (int, long, datetime) the boundary value.
- For string and JSON the number of characters.
- For Set the number of elements.

parameters.description:
Resource-type-dependent template parameters.
Specifying a value creates or updates the given key. Specifying null for value deletes the corresponding key.

roleId.description: The role definition identifier. Role definitions and their identifiers can be found by querying the system API.

objectId.description:
The object id for the role assignment that must be formatted according to its associated type.
For the DomainName ObjectIdType, ObjectId must begin with the "@" character.

objectIdType.description:
The type of the role assignment. With the exception of the DeviceId type, the types correspond to properties of an AAD object. The DeviceId type corresponds to
the device id in the topology.
The UserId type assigns a role to a user.
The DeviceId type assigns a role to a device.
The DomainName type assigns a role to a domain name. Each user with the specified domain name will have the access rights of the corresponding role.
The TenantId type assigns a role to a tenant. Each user belonging to the specified tenant id will have the access rights of the corresponding role.
The ServicePrincipalId type assigns a role to a service principal object id.

tenantId.description:
The tenant identifier.
Disallowed for DeviceId and TenantId ObjectIdTypes.
Required for UserId and ServicePrincipalId ObjectIdTypes.
Optional for the DomainName ObjectIdType.
